document.heading: Public Land Surplus Standards Amendment Act of 2009

history.narrative: Law 18-115, the “Public Land Surplus Standards Amendment Act of 2009”, was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 18-76, which was referred to the Committee on Government Operations and the Environment. The bill was adopted on first and second readings on December 1, 2009, and December 15, 2009, respectively. Approved without the signature of the Mayor on January 14, 2010, it was assigned Act No. 18-263 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 18-115 became effective on March 11, 2010.
